intro: Silene melandrioides, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Silene melandrioides is an important plant for pollinators and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
